review:
Könnt ihr euch noch an den Typen erinnern, der in eurer Kindheit eure Sandburgen kaputt gemacht hat? Oder die Bauklötzchentürme? Ja? Sehr schön, denn hier schlüpft ihr quasi in die Rolle von genau diesem Typen oder besser gesagt, in die der Zootiere, die eure Zoos aus Zoo Tycoon platt machen.
Denn in diesem Spiel steuert ihr ein beliebiges Tier und müsst so viel Schaden anrichten, wie ihr in einer Minute schaffen könnt.
Dabei ist es egal, ob ihr Zäune einreißt, die Parkbänke und Klos demoliert, Bäume fällt, Besucher über den Haufen rennt oder den Souvenirshop zerlegt, es gibt alles eine entsprechende Menge an Punkten. Da ihr ein ausgebüchstes Tier seid, sind euch dabei aber auch die Tierpfleger mit Elektroschockern auf den Fersen, die ihr ebenso umrennen könnt (oder besser solltet), denn die sind in der Lage, euch zu fangen und damit dann das Game Over hervorbringen.

Da man es im Hotseat mit bis zu 4 Spielern zusammen spielen kann, ist es ein schönes Spiel, wenn Freunde zu Besuch sind und man einfach etwas machen möchte, wofür nicht viel Hirn vonnöten ist. Da die Karte statisch ist und man sich nur innerhalb der Größe des Bildschirms bewegen kann, handelt es sich dabei auch nicht um einen Split Screen. Gewonnen hat, wer am Ende der Runde die meisten Punkte hat.

Dabei ist das Spielprinzip denkbar einfach und, naja, auch sehr stumpf und stupide, was hier allerdings nicht negativ ist. Damit ist es eigentlich für alle Altersgruppen geeignet und kann sicher auch mal als interaktives Angebot auf einer Familienfeier oder Hochzeit (neben der omnipräsenten Photobox) präsentiert werden. Dabei ist auch egal, welches Tier man am Ende nimmt, denn auch Pinguine können Steinmauern einreißen und natürlich auch Besucher und Pfleger über den Haufen rennen.

Schaut man jetzt noch auf den Preis von 4€, dann kann man hier schwer nein sagen, wenn man einfach mal ein Spiel für zwischendurch oder den nächsten Kumpelsabend geplant hat. Bonus, wenn alle 'n bissel was im Tee haben. ;-)

Аркадная игрушка в которой мы играем за зверей сбежавших из зоопарка. Их достало отношение людей и жизнь в клетках и они отправляются мстить! Топтать и убивать людей, взырвать машины, уничтожать деревья, скамейки, заборы и даже здания... По геймплею все просто - есть небольшая локация где расположено много всего, что можно уничтожить. Мы выбираем зверя и бежим все крушить, при этом избегая отловщиков животных (ну или вовремя убивая их). Цель каждого уровня набрать определенное количество очков к истечению таймера. Если набрали столько сколько нужно, то открывается следующий уровень. Игра порадовала и она весьма необычна по концепции. Чего ей нехватает, так это оптимизации... Но это не очень смертельно. Рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027934177', 'num_games_owned': 2200, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1418851927}
review:
I feel this game could have been so much more. It's a great concept, but it just doesn't deliver.

Here you are, playing a game of a certain quality that was, fifteen years ago, free on random websites like miniclip and the likes. Now, here we are, expected to pay $4 for it. This feels like the individual's first take on game design. With that said, it's a good first commercial game for a new developer. However, as a consumer, I don't give two shits about their milestone or not, I wanna discuss whether or not this would have been worth the $4 I could have paid for it and if it is worth the amount of time I invested in it already.

The answer is no, it's not. The idea is good, but the implementation is not. The levels are small, the gameplay is lacking, the destruction is for some reason unsatisfying, and it sorta feels the same no matter the animal choice. The game is just for short amusement, then it gets forgotten. No lie, playing Zoo Tycoon and releasing animals is more interesting and satisfying than this game, and that's suppose to be the premise of this title!

First thing I would change is the park size. You don't leave the screen you see. You don't scroll anywhere as you move to the edge of the screen, it's just it. I feel it would be more interesting if the park was larger with both more to explore and destroy.

Second, I would give the game a better goal rather than ranking up a high score of damage within a set time. How about, maybe, the goal of escaping a park? Then they could have animal captures you gotta avoid and the likes, all trying to prevent you from leaving. It would be interesting. 

Finally, I'll say something is wrong with the destruction and people targetting. It's all unsatisfying. You are challenged to get a good score, but I cannot help but feel I don't really care if I get a good score or not in this game, it's all just bullshit to proceed to the next level. Maybe make it so destruction isn't view as necessary for the incentives and focus on making destruction the incentive of actually playing the game?

Overall, I will have to say pass. I'm glad I got a free key, but I won't let that bias my opinion. I don't think this game will deliver the satisfaction you're looking for. It's a shame, it really is. Normally, I try to make a pros and cons list, but I cannot really make one for this game because there isn't enough meat to nitpick or praise for. 

4/10

Sorry, I really wanted this to be good. It could have been, but it's not.





Disclaimer: I recieved this key for free, but that does not influence my opinion in this or any of my reviews.

review:
[h1]"When nature strikes back"[/h1]
You know those sundays when many noisy visitors rush the zoos? When children are screaming for icecream and balloons. And humans gazing at us as if we are cute cotton stuffed animals. Select your favourite animal and within 3 secs you gonna breakout in an unstoppable rampage. Look how fast these little monkeys can run. Wahahaha. Remember how they've thrown litter and peanuts after us? Now it's your payback time. Ram their fat bottoms into the sky. But pls beware of the guards that want to taze you and frame you again. How many years you've been waiting for a decent haystack of genuine African savanna grass? Now they get paid double and twice. Epic explosions like in a Michael Bay movie, breaking walls and collapsing buildings. Armageddon in your favourite place of shallow entertainment. What a hellish good fun. After playing this game you'll never touch Jumanji again. Doesn't matter if it's repetive, buggy or mobileware. The chance for revenge is there and you should take it now. Do it! Don't let your dreams be dreams. Liveout with over a dozen different deadly animals your slapping sprees (actually noone dies).

author: {'steamid': '76561198068187213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1460996124}
review:
[h1] Zoo Rampage [/h1]

Zoo Rampage ist ein eher kleineres Spiel mit nur 7 Level und als Spiel für Zwischendurch anzusehen.


[b] Spiel: [/b]

Der Sinn des Spieles ist mit dem Tier deiner Wahl alle Zoobesucher und Wärter immer wieder zu überrennen und soviel Schaden wie möglich anzurichten. Abgesehen von den beiden Sonderwelten mit Elefanten Fußball und Pinguin Füttern. Es ist wenn man Kinder hat vielleicht ein ganz nettes Spiel oder halt als Lückenfüller. In den ersten 30 Minuten wird man auch massiv mit Errungenschaften überschüttet. Im Späteren Verlauf wird dies dann seltener und man muss deutlich Zielstrebiger darauf hinarbeiten.


[b] Einstellungen: [/b]

Einstellungen kann man vornehmen aber sind nicht nötig außer ggf. die Musik auszuschalten.


[b] Errungenschaften: [/b]

Errungenschaften Funktionieren alle und können wenn man genug Zeit in dieses Spiel Investieren will alle Problemlos erreicht werden.


[b] Fazit: [/b]

Das Spielprinzip verliert sehr schnell seinen Reiz und auf Dauer wird es irgendwann langweilig. Ich war froh es durch zu haben und alle Errungenschaften erspielt zu haben. 

[b] Im Sale ja ansonsten eher nicht!

review:
Zoo Rampage n'est pas un jeu extraordinaire mais simplement un bon gros délire bien meilleur avec des amis. Je le classe dans la catégorie des originaux tout comme un certain Goat Simulator mais dans un genre un peu différent. On appréciera l'idée de base ainsi que les niveaux spéciaux (le foot avec un éléphant et l'agression des pêcheurs par un pingouin) mais la durée de vie du jeu est extrêmement courte. Proposé environ 4€ Zoo Rampage pourra vous faire passer une ou deux heures sympathiques avec des amis mais si vous comptez y jouer seul, un petite réduction ne sera pas de trop.

review:
En lançant Zoo Rampage, je pensais arriver sur un jeu de gestion. La surprise fut grande quand j'ai compris qu'il fallait en fait détruire totalement un parc d'attraction ! Concept amusant qui m'a très vite fait penser au jeu "Demolition Inc.".
Le gameplay est ultra basique, à part les flèches directionnelles et un bouton frapper, vous n'avez besoin de rien d'autres.
Votre objectif est de détruire un maximum d'objets dans le parc à l'aide d'un animal, de délivrer les autres animaux retenus dans les enclos, et d'écraser gardes et visiteurs.
Le concept est sacrément fun, mais le contenu est vraiment trop léger. Vous devrez vous contenter de 7 niveaux, dont seulement 3 sont des Zoo. 2 autres se déroulent en ville, et enfin, les derniers sont des niveaux un peu plus originaux, marquer des buts avec éléphant sur un stade de foot, et ramasser des poissons lachés par des pecheurs à l'aide d'un pingouin.
Autant vous dire que 7 niveaux c'est très vite fait, sachant que la mission dure 1 minute ! Bref, vous pouvez avoir fait le tour du jeu en une quinzaine de minutes si vous réussisez du premier coup les scores nécessaires pour déverouiller le niveau suivant.
Au début de la mission vous aurez le choix entre plusieurs animaux du parc. A vous de choisir lequel vous utiliserez pour le ruiner ! Elephant, Rhinocéros, Zèbre, Giraffe, Gorille, Crocodile etc.
Peu de bugs rencontrés durant ces quelques heures de jeu, ci ce n'est que par moment les visiteurs restent buggés dès le démarrage de la mission.
Le jeu se joue en solo ou à 4 en coop local.
Au niveau des succès, il y en a 45 ! Comptez 3 heures pour tous les déverouiller, les plus longs étant d'écraser 5,000 visiteurs, et 2,500 gardes du zoo.

Les + :
- Le concept du jeu
- La jouabilité simple et efficace
- Amusant
- Le prix (3,99€)
- Coop local à 4

Les - :
- Trop peu de contenu ! (7 niveaux pour une douzaine d'animaux).
- Le bug des visiteurs figés
- Une durée de vie très courte, quelques minutes sont nécessaires pour tout voir.

Les succès :
Solo : Oui
Multi : Non
Durée : 3 heures
Difficulté : Ultra Facile

review:
Zoo Rampage.

Игра лаконична, уровни забавны, а спектр играбельных животных - разнообразен (от полярного медведя до разьяренного крокодильчика).

Может Zoo Rampage кому-то и не пришла по вкусу, но пройдя всю игру и получив 100% достижений, понимаешь, что это того стоило. В некоторых моментах чувствуешь азарт, когда несколько полицейских гонятся за тобой. Или игра может наоборот, жутко раздражать, как например в эпизоде со слонами и футболом тебе не удается забить последний мяч в ворота вовремя. 

В игре имеется совместное локальное (не по сети) прохождение уровней, где количество игроков может достигнуть числа - "4". С компанией куда интереснее!

В конечном итоге, советую покупать эту игру желательно со скидкой, также важно, чтобы Вас не напрягала графика и ограниченность уровней. Тем более этот симулятор крушений представляет Вам карточки, которые можно продать, немного оправдав игру.

review:
Did you ever think of sheding your clothing, hiding in the bushes and pouncing on unsuspecting passerby's... causing massive mayhem and getting on the Five o Clock news... Remember that one time the friend decided to put a sewing needle on the end of the Nerf bow and arrow kit... yes I still have the scars....  If you did these things above... this game is probably for you...

Very cheap, fun and casual... Zoo Rampage is just what it sounds like, you choose an animal and go on a rampage.. racking up a high score, killing Tourist, and generally wrecking things.  Think of Rampage with less Giant Mutated monsters and more like real life animals crashing a Zoo exhibit.  

The game isn't the longest game ever, you can probably do everything in the game in under 4 hours, but the price is low and you'll find yourself going back to replay it even after you've unlocked all the content...

author: {'steamid': '76561198070627881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1420510491}
review:
Initially I was having a great time pretending to be a gorilla busting out of confinement, and being a ferocious tiger, attacking the trainer I once loved, was more than thrilling. And giraffes!? I love giraffes, and trampling over the poor souls of those I imagined looking at me with wide eyes was amusing to say the least.

What more, Zoo Rampage has 45 achievements, all seemingly possible to attain, however, moving through each level is neccesary for those achievement hunters.

I've put nearly two hours into Zoo Rampage and have only been able to play two of the seven levels. A set amount of points is neccesary to pass each level, and each time I played, it seemed I would be just under the requirement. Granted, the game does have the option for local co-op, which would probably make things easier, however, I have no real life friends. 

The developers recently updated the game, making it more difficult, as players were reporting that it was too easy upon its release. It's no longer easy. It's damn hard. A difficulty setting would surely cure this ailment and keep more people playing beyond an hour or so.

It pains me to give Zoo Rampage the big fat thumbs down because it had it's moments. It was fun while it lasted, but Zoo Rampage became to frustrating, and I just gave up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993698981', 'num_games_owned': 11065, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1424664654}
review:
It's pretty bad. 

Maybe with multiple people playing it there might be a bit more fun but as is it's not really much of a game.  

Sure it's fun to smash and destroy, the whole concept of the game is great and the physics is spot-on, they really have a nice game in theory but there's a few really limiting factors.  

You only get to play for 1 minute at a time.  You can basically destroy everything in the scene in that minute, or at least most of the destructables, but you have to play the levels over and over again until you get a high enough score.  The satisfaction of destroying a few buildings is removed when you have to repeat yourself like that.  There's even a thread in the discussion area of people trying to build strategies on how to pass the first level, it took me quite a few tries to get past it.  The novelty of smashing wears off quick. 

What would be more enjoyable, is if the levels were huge.  Maybe like an entire Zoo, or small town?  The destruction and chaos would be a bit more of a thrill if there was more exploration to it, but I understand you only have so big of a viewing window to work with and with 4 players on screen this is pretty much all you can expect.  You will have just as much fun looking at screenshots than actually playing.  

So I don't know what the game needs exactly, but it's not game of the year.  For the price, it's a high quality piece of work and if you plan on playing it with friends you guys are going to have a blast 60 seconds at a time.  Have fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032863486', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1411548065}
review:
動物園の動物になって檻から脱走、猪突猛進走り回るだけという主旨の超単純凶暴なコンセプトが素晴らしい。

追いかけまわしてくる動物園職員のスタンガン（？）の餌食にならぬよう、1分以内にどれだけ大暴れできたかを判定されます。それだけです。操作も単純です。面によりますが像、虎、ゴリラ、サイ、キリン等々好きな動物を選択可。

一歩でも無駄に歩いている時間が無いよう、常に何かを破壊し続けるよう気を遣い合理的な動き、道筋を判断し動かす事により高得点を狙います。

キーボードでもプレイ可ですが箱コンなどを強く推奨します。どのような意図なのか分からない位ボリュームが無さすぎですが途中で作るのが面倒臭くなったのでしょうか？でもトレカが付いてたりします。実績も45個とかありますが、2時間もやれば9割方取れてしまいます。半日もやらずにコンプできるのでは？試してませんがローカル4人プレイに対応。

途中、本来の主旨から全く外れてるだろうというある面をプレイさせられるのですがこれがかなり最悪です。何かの悪ふざけなのでしょうか？ここだけは糞ゲもいいとこです。2分以内にある事を10回成功させなくてはいけないのですが、無理ゲに限りなく近い。まぐれじゃないとクリアできないと思います。

[b]ゲーム全体をクリアするのに2時間かからないところこの全く面白くもなんともない糞面だけで1時間半近くかかりました。[/b]

この糞面、突然高さの概念が出てきます。そこから判断しタイミングを取らなくてはいけないと思うのですが、このゲームの視点では容易ではありません。そしてある程度精密な操作も要求されるのですが、デッドゾーンの設定がうまくないようで、勝手に動いてしまったりするのです。これは絶対にオプション設定させるべきです。また、上手く行ったと思っても「良」と判断されない事が多々あって意味が分かりません。やり直しリロードもサクッといきません。作者さんこれを本当に面白いと思ったのでしょうか？これはこれで練り直して別作品にするべきです。

それから、エンディングが無い…の…？ていうか最後の面がなんだか良く分かりませんでした。これで完成してるのか？って感じのなんか投げやりな作りの面でしたね。

セールで278円で買いましたが、上記糞面でかなりイライラして嫌な思いをさせられたのを無かったことにすれば定価の398円でも見合うものだと思います。が、願わくばいくらなんでももうちょいボリュームがあればなという事と点数ランキングくらいネット対応してくれたらなという感じです。自分のハイスコアすら現在は見られないようです。

でもこんな安いものでも[url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/312900/announcements]アップデート[/url]ちょこちょこしているようですので良心的な開発者なのだと思いますよ。

review:
Bought Zoo Rampage on a whim to play local multiplayer with against a friend of mine. It was entertaining for probably 1-2 minutes before we had seen all the game has to offer. For $10, that's just not enough.
It's a terribly imbalanced game - every round can be determined immediately by whoever is closest to the the largest building/group of cars. The first person to get to that gets a ton of points in the first 20 seconds and then the rest of the round is meaningless.
The other (non-destruction) modes seem like they were never playtested even once - the soccer mode is a joke because the players get completely stuck on each other whenever they come in contact, making it very difficult to move around.
Unfortunately, it's just a mediocre game that doesn't quite make it into the "so bad it's good" category.
I'd say skip this one unless you think 2 minutes of mild entertainment is worth $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011726945', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1405973321}
review:
I'm surprised that it took that long for game developers to discover the enormous potential lying in this concept. After playing countless hours of both Zoo Tycoons and Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis, the best part of the entire experience was when I set my animals free in my 100%-ishly built park and let them demolish it to dust (also eat the visitors in JPOG and get a Game Over mere minutes after completing the very same park, lol).
This game is incredibly epic, but it could use some (MUCH) more content and if you look at the price tag, you'll understand what I mean. There's just so much potential in it I don't even know where to begin (tons of more maps, animals, game mods, leaderboards, online functions, Freakin' Dinosaurs like in good old Zoo Tycoon (2) and the list goes on).
I really hope that it'll eventually get more content, otherwise it won't entertain you for too long as the entire game can be completed in less than an hour and with a single playthrough you can get almost every achievements.
That aside I really like the concept and it's arcade-ish feel, but I played flash games longer than this one.

I recommend to everyone who are reading this to wait for a discount and Dear Developers, be sure to expand the experience! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197989373460', 'num_games_owned': 4977, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1405270800}
review:
Syf do dostania za darmo za głos na Greenlight. Gra jest przede wszystkim skandalicznie krótka, dość powiedzieć, że można ją skończyć w mniej niż 15 min (mamy 7 małych aren, na których spędzamy po 2 min). 
Żeby zapoznać się z tym co tytuł oferuje, wystarczy tylko 120 sekund. Każda kolejna mapka stawia przed nami dokładnie to samo "wyzwanie" - rozwalić wszystko i wszystkich, bo tak. Wszystko jest punktowane, co teoretycznie ma zachęcić do ostrzejszej rywalizacji, bowiem Zoo Rampage oferuje lokalnego co-opa dla 4 osób. Tylko komu by się chciało w to grać ze znajomymi?

Dźwięki dostępne w grze powodują krwawienie z uszu, a sztampowa muzyka irytuje mocno. Do tego bugi, kiepska optymalizacja, kulejąca fizyka, mierny gameplay. Totalny bezsens, wstyd mi, że na to głosowałem.

Na plus wygląd - bo nie starszy, a i da się odróżnić co tam się na ekranie dzieje, kto wyleciał w powietrze itp. No i dropi karty, a osiągnięcia wpadają same. Toteż w ramach pokuty postanowiłem wbić je wszystkie i tym samym to mój pierwszy calak.

Plusy:
+ dropi karty i łatwo wbić acziki
+ nie wygląda najgorzej

Minusy:
- tragiczny gameplay
- kiepsko zoptymalizowana i zabugowana
- irytujące audio
- brzydzę się sobą, że oddałem na to głos :(

Ocena: [b]1/10[/b] - chyba w nic gorszego nie grałem.

review:
Was passiert wenn ein Tier aus dem Zoo ausbricht und total ausflippt?
Dieses Szenario kann man in leicht übertriebenen Sinne in diesem Spiel miterleben. Man ist in der Rolle eines der Zootiere und zerstört den Zoo und danach auch die Stadt. Neben 5 dieser Zerstörungslevel gibt es noch ein Fussballspiel und eine Fütterung.
Alles in Allem macht das Spiel auf jeden Fall Spaß und ist im Mehrspielermodus sicher nochmal um einiges lustiger. Leider gibt es keinen Onlinemodus und somit muss man sich mit seinen realen Freunden in der realen Welt zum Spielen verabreden. Meiner Meinung nach sollte es auf jeden Fall noch einen Onlinemodus geben, denn wer will sich schon mit realen Menschen befassen ;)
Allerdings muss ich sagen, dass der Preis noch etwas hoch ist. Es gibt nur 7 Level die man jeweils 1 - 2 oder 5 Minuten spielt. Somit bekommt man meiner Meinung nach ein bischen wenig für sein Geld.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007581767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1405091770}
review:
After playing for half an hour and finishing the game I gotta say that I'm dissapointed with it and I just can't recommend it.

I was not expecting much from it, but certainly more than 20 minutes of main campaign length (literally) and a bit more challenging gameplay. There are only 5 levels and 3 or 4 bonus ones and that's it, and while playing them I unlocked 70% of the achievements. It is extremely repetitive, you get to play with around a dozen different animals, but every animal plays exactly the same: move with the directional pad and press A to attack. You storm around wrecking everything on your path to get a high score. No challenges, no powerups, no unlockables, nothing. Animations are wonky and human AI is retarded, they keep getting stuck everywere. Physics are nuts, having a snake sending a car flying by headbutting it and the such. Multiplayer is only local. 

As probably most of the other reviewers here did, I got my key for free from Who's Gaming Now, so I am not complaining about the price in my particular case... but those paying 10€ for this will be extremely annoyed and surely feel scammed after finishing everything this game has to offer in barely 30 minutes. It's ok if you get it in a bundle or for like 2€, but it is not worth its price tag. I have played better and way more fun phone apps for less than one buck. Obviosly this is a game to enjoy with friends having some silly time along with Singstar, but never for this price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022997080', 'num_games_owned': 2142, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1405263252}
review:
Zoo Rampage is the equivalent of an animal train wreck. Taking control of a selection of captive zoo creatures, you are let loose in a map of helpless humans and buildings, free to wreak as much havoc as possible until the bell rings. The idea is outrageous, and for a few minutes actually entertaining, but after a single level Zoo Rampage has already demonstrated to you the entirety of what it is: a shallow, admittedly amusing up to a (very brief) point, game with a serious shortage of content and objectives. Even had it been loaded with levels and modes, the core of its gameplay is so simple that it would ultimately be for naught to try and extend an experience that has already grown stale.

There's really nothing more I can say about Zoo Rampage, so extreme is its curtness that you can see absolutely everything it has to offer in a matter of minutes. It would be a hard sell at a dollar, its only real draw being a silly thing to turn on for a few moments when you have some friends around, but at ten times that it's a sad joke that I desperately hope people do not buy into. Zoo Rampage couldn't fill the average demo, let alone sustain itself as a full retail product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010402463', 'num_games_owned': 6230, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1405441504}
review:
Bardzo przyjemna gierka, przy której można się nieźle zrelaksować. Gra nieco w stylu Goat Simulator tylko z widokiem izometrycznym i możliwością wybrania kilkunastu zwierząt, które są dostępne w grze (m.in. goryl, krokodyl, pingwin). Ogólnie w grze chodzi o jak największe sianie popłochu, za które jesteśmy wynagradzani punktami. Niszczymy wszystko co staje nam na drodze i obijamy ludzików. Gra do ambitnych może nie należy, ale świetnie bawi zwłaszcza, że można grać ze znajomymi w co-opie i prześcigiwać się o najlepszy wynik.
Plusy:
- rozgrywka, która nieźle bawi
- kilkanaście zwierząt do wyboru
- przyzwoita grafika i zabawna fizyka
- lokalny co-op do 4 osób
- strzelanie słoniem do bramki :p
Minusy:
- bardzo krótka (do godziny można zdobyć wszystkie acziki)
- po jakimś czasie nuży
- cena

Ocena: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054689888', 'num_games_owned': 5101, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1405120998}
review:
То что Вы можете наблюдать на геймплейном видео, это вся игра. Больше там ничего нет. Абсолютно.
Игра вышла вчера и первое, что удивило больше всего, что она является законченным проектом, а не ранним доступом.
Это странно хотя бы по той причине, что игра содержит ряд недостатков, которые неприемлимы для полной версии игры:
- короткая (да, игра проходится за 20 минут)
- отсутствует сюжет (разрушь все - это не сюжет)
- отсутствует реиграбельность (необходимость ее вытекает из первого недостатка)
- малое разнообразие (мало предметов, животных, врагов, карт и вообще всего мало)
Единственным плюсом игры является наличие кооператива для 2-4 игроков.
Ко всему прочему, у игры низкая стабильность работы.

Однако, мне понравилась отзывчивость разработчика. Поэтому, в надеждах на скорейшие патчи и дополнения, обзор положителен.
